category: Herbs that Transform Phlegm and Stop Coughing

action.primary: Moistens the Lungs, relieves cough and clears the voice
Comforts the Liver and regulates the Qi

indications: Flank and epigastric pain due to Qi Stagnation

action.primary: Promotes healing of ulcerated, suppurating sores

contraindications: Use with caution for those with loss of voice due to Wind-Cold.

useCases: Dry cough, hoarseness and pain and swelling of the throat
Pain due to stagnant Qi in the Liver and Stomach

notes: This herb is traditionally not referred to frequently, however it has recently been used quite frequently.
This herb also treats Damp-Heat in the Lower Jiao.
It is also said to harmonize the Stomach and promote regeneration.

Mu Hu Die and Sm. Sterculae Lychnophorae #{PangDaHai} Pang Da Hai are two of the best herbs to restore loss of voice. They can be taken as tea through the day for those who need to speak or sing for a prolonged period of time.
